javadoc: Class manage a header for the FieldViewer.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new FieldHeader for the given model.

methods.javadoc: Called when the model's layout changes.
methods.name: update
methods.comment: Called when the model's layout changes.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the cursor shape that appropriate for the given location.  If the location
 is near a boundary, then the cursor will change to a RESIZE shape, otherwise
 it will be the default cursor.
methods.name: setCursor
methods.comment:
Sets the cursor shape that appropriate for the given location.  If the location
 is near a boundary, then the cursor will change to a RESIZE shape, otherwise
 it will be the default cursor.

methods.javadoc: Callback for when the mouse button is pressed.
methods.name: pressed
methods.comment: Callback for when the mouse button is pressed.

methods.javadoc: Callback for when the mouse button is released.
methods.name: released
methods.comment: Callback for when the mouse button is released.

methods.javadoc: Callback for when the mouse is dragged.
methods.name: dragged
methods.comment: Callback for when the mouse is dragged.

methods.javadoc: Callback as the user is resizing a field.
methods.name: resize
methods.comment: Callback as the user is resizing a field.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the row in the model that the point is over.
@param p the point for which to find its corresponding row.
methods.name: getRow
methods.comment: Returns the row in the model that the point is over.

params.name: p
params.comment: the point for which to find its corresponding row.

methods.name: getCol
methods.comment: Returns the index of the field on the given row containing the give x pos.

params.name: row
params.comment: the row on which to find the index of the field contianing the x coordinate.

methods.javadoc: Returns the preferredSize for this header component.
methods.name: getPreferredSize
methods.comment: Returns the preferredSize for this header component.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a FieldHeaderLocation for the given point
@param p the point to get a location for.
methods.name: getFieldHeaderLocation
methods.comment: Returns a FieldHeaderLocation for the given point

params.name: p
params.comment: the point to get a location for.

name: FieldHeaderComp
comment: Class manage a header for the FieldViewer.
